$interpreted: Lio: Hey, shouldn't we chase after her?
Nigel: Forget about her. You guys don't need my protection anyway.
Lio: Don't talk like that. This is so unlike the Nigel I used to know.
Nigel: I just...I just don't want to lose someone precious to me again.
Lio: You're doing very well. In fact, I know that everyone is very thankful for what you have done for us.
Nigel: You don't have to console me. Leah was right; I really am useless. I couldn't even stop Eve from leaving...
Lio: Eve left for her own reasons. It's not your fault she left; you shouldn't beat yourself up about it.
Nigel: Is that so?
Lio: Nigel, you should trust us a little more. We're willing to shoulder the burden with you, together!
Nigel: Thank you. You really are a good child.
Lio: But Leah is...
Nigel: I know. I was in the wrong back there too.  I will apologize to her later.
Leah: Yikes. Don't come near me!
Nigel: Leah! I'll be there right now!
Lio: I-I'll help out too!
Leah: Scary, so scary...is that the Ragdoll Coroner?
Lio: It's okay. Nigel and I took care of him.
Nigel: Let me uncover your true identity.
Eugene: Ugh......
Leah: Eugene!?
Lio: This guy's the Ragdoll Coroner?
Nigel: Heck no. This guy just wanted to make it seem his crimes were caused by some fake, legendary monster.
NIgel: Just before I rescued you guys, I found Phil's body on the other side...
Lio: You mean...Phil's...

Nigel: This piece of cloth was held tightly in Phil's hand.
Looks like he yanked it off someone when he was struggling.
Nigel: This is yours, isn't it?
Eugene: No......
Nigel: Speak, now. You killed him, didn't you!
Eugene: I-It's a misunderstanding! It wasn't me!
Eugene: Have mercy! Okay, okay, I'll talk! That brat Phil, he spilled dye on my new shoes.
Eugene: I was so mad at him back then! He was such a lousy worker and it always got me in trouble with the boss. So I...
Nigel: You killed him over this!? You little...!
Nigel: The Slums aren't too far away from here. Can you guys go back first? Get some adults out here to carry Phil's body back.
Leah: ...Let's go, Lio.
